member.name: T:Configuration.API.Client.DTOs.Output.V1.ConfigurationEntryDto
member.summary: The model for a configuration entry resource.

member.name: P:Configuration.API.Client.DTOs.Output.V1.ConfigurationEntryDto.ConfigurationEntryType
member.summary: This is the type of configuration entry? Examples: ApplicationSetting, ConnectionString, FeatureToggle (flag).

member.name: P:Configuration.API.Client.DTOs.Output.V1.ConfigurationEntryDto.DataType
member.summary: An optional attribute that stores information about the data type of the value (string, boolean, etc.). This can be inspected and used to ensure applications process the value properly.

member.name: P:Configuration.API.Client.DTOs.Output.V1.ConfigurationEntryDto.Label
member.summary: An optional descriptor used to differentiate configuration entries (outside of environment and application descriptors). Use labels as a way to create multiple versions of a configuration entry. For example, you can input an application version number or a Git commit ID in labels to identify key-values associated with a particular software build.

member.name: P:Configuration.API.Client.DTOs.Output.V1.ConfigurationEntryDto.DisplayName
member.summary: An optional display name for the configuration entry. If one is not provided, the key will be used.

member.name: P:Configuration.API.Client.DTOs.Output.V1.ConfigurationEntryDto.Key
member.summary: Keys serve as case-sensitive, unicode-based string identifiers for key-value pairs and are referenced when storing and retrieving corresponding values. Hierarchical namespaces are created by using a ":" separator (by convention).

member.name: P:Configuration.API.Client.DTOs.Output.V1.ConfigurationEntryDto.Value
member.summary: The configuration value.

member.name: T:Configuration.API.Client.DTOs.Output.V1.EnvironmentDto
member.summary: The model for a specific application environment.

member.name: T:Configuration.API.Client.DTOs.Output.V1.HttpConnectionInfoDto
member.summary: The model for HTTP connection information.
